Smart contracts are self-executing contracts with the terms of the agreement written directly into lines of code. They are stored and replicated on a blockchain, a decentralized and distributed ledger technology. Smart contracts can be used to automate various tasks, such as payment processing, supply chain management, and more.
However, like any other technology, smart contracts can be vulnerable to various types of attacks, including:
1\. **Reentrancy attacks**: These occur when a contract calls another contract, which in turn calls back to the original contract, creating an infinite loop that drains funds.
